isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL AIR SUSPENSION WITH TAPERED LEAF SPRINGS - CAB AIR RELEASE - OPERATION

svcproc.title: OPERATION
svcproc.para: With "cab air control" the air piping for the system includes an air switch and an inversion valve ( Figure 8 and Figure 9).

step1.para: The control valve in the instrument panel has two positions. In the RUN position, the valve is closed. Placing the valve in the DUMP position opens the valve and sends air pressure to an inversion valve located near the leveling valve.
With the cab control valve, the rear hosing incorporates the inversion valve as follows:

step2.para: The air supply to the height control valve comes from the pressure protection valve. Air is delivered from the height control valve to the inversion valve which distributes air to the right and left air spring systems. The inversion valve has no other function with the "cab control valve" in the RUN position.
Placing the "cab control valve" in the DUMP position directs air to the inversion valve causing it to stop the air supply to the air springs and dump the air from the air springs.
Placing the "cab control valve" back into the RUN position returns air spring control to the height control valve and the air springs will inflate until the vehicle is level.
